title: Officer Applications for 2015-2016
content: Officer applications for the 2015-2016 school year are now open! Download the application and type your responses directly into the document. Make sure to email them to president@hhsprogramming.com by Friday, May 8 at 3:10 PM.

title: In-House Competition
content: Participate in Programming Club's very first In-House Competition from 10pm-12pm today! Create or join a team here.

title: Mario DIY Workshop
content:
Welcome to the 2014-2015 Mario Workshop 2.0!
Download this zip file and load the src files into a new project in your IDE. Ask an officer if you need help.
You will be challenged with a series of tasks, both easy and hard. Here is the list.
After completing a task, inform an official and we will update the leaderboard.
It's uh me Mario!

title: Competition Training
content:
Come to our meeting today to practice problems and train for competitions, like USACO, Stanford ProCo, and the Harker Programming Invitational.

Try out the problems here and then see how you're doing on the leaderboard!

title: New Android Project
content: We have a new Android project this week, a drawing app. As usual, follow the tutorial. Also, remember to sign up for the Harker Programming Invitational!

title: Android App Workshop!
content: Create your first Android app by following our step-by-step tutorial! The project is an Easy Button.

title: 14th Meeting
content: Today we'll be working on challenge problems and having a mini competition! Pair up with someone and work on these problems and check out the leaderboard!

title: Thirteenth Meeting
content: Solve a challenge problem at our meeting today and recieve some free swag!

title: Happy Holidays!
content: Our New Year Social will take place on January 3 from 11am to 4pm, be sure to come! RSVP here, and bring $3 if you want pizza.

title: Web Workshop
content:
This week we are beginning web development.
  • For beginners, learn HTML via Codecademy and this powerpoint.
  • Practice HTML/CSS by replicating basic designs.
  • If you already know Java, learn JavaScript through this cheatsheet.
  • Build a number guessing game to learn the basics of JavaScript.
  • Finally, build Cookie Clicker with JavaScript

title: PicoCTF is Officially Over
content:
The PicoCTF Competition is officially over!
We would like to thank and congratulate all teams that participated in helping Homestead reach 5th place for most points! Go Homestead Programming Club!

title: PicoCTF!
content: This week we will be focusing on PicoCTF!

title: Sixth Meeting: Debug Competition
content: Download Debug! Head to this page to submit solutions. Also check the leaderboard

title: Fifth Meeting
content: Download Triangle Adventures! Check this Google Doc for a guide to completing the levels. Also remember to submit a t-shirt design by Wednesday, 10/8.

title: Fourth Meeting
content: Download the game for today's workshop, Triangle Adventures! Check this Google Doc for a guide to completing the levels. Also remember to submit a t-shirt design by Wednesday, 10/8.

title: Third Meeting
content: Submit a t-shirt design by Wednesday, October 8. The winner gets a free t-shirt! Be sure to download our logos.

title: Club 'N' Grub
content:
Hello loyal HHS Programming Members!

Show us your support by coming out to Club 'N' Grub this Wednesday (Sept. 17) to flaunt your Programming Club spirit. This year we will be serving Panda Express (Super Yum!) so make sure to buy your tickets early and head out to our booth.

We hope to see you there!

title: Sound Workshop
content:
At today's meeting we'll be using a sound library in Java.

Download this Eclipse project to start off with, and open the this Google Doc for tasks to complete.

title: Second Meeting!
content: Is Starbucks too expensive? Java is free at Programming Club! Come to our meeting on Wednesday (Sept. 10) after seventh skinny for a fun workshop no matter your skill level.

title: First Informational Meeting
content:
Come to A211 this Thursday at lunch to learn all about our club!

We will be discussing the perks of being a member, the events we plan on hosting, and conduct a survey to find out what YOU are interested in learning!

We hope to see you there!
